content.title: Homepage v2: Hero
content.headline: Investing capital and operational expertise in founders who are reshaping their industries

content.value: Project A. The Operational VC.

successStories.quote: > "Project A has been a staunch supporter of Trade Republic accompanying us in critical moments of our rapid development.”
successStories.summary: Trade Republic is Europe’s mobile-first commission free broker. Its mission is to democratize access to capital markets and close the European pension gap. After raising one of the largest funding rounds in Europe, Trade Republic now ranks among the highest valued FinTechs.

successStories.quote: > "We helped Trade Republic hire over 50 talents with a dedicated team of our recruiters and sourcers selected for their ability to drive company growth."
successStories.summary: Our Talent Acquisition team collaborated with Trade Republic on one of the most important things for a startup: hire the right bright-minded and talented people. The operational support includes the entire recruitment process from setting up the recruiting plan to sourcing and hiring.

successStories.quote: > "Having the expertise of Project A helped us take the next step from startup to scale up."
successStories.summary: Kry has taken telemedicine to the next level enabling people across Europe to see a doctor without actually having to go to one. We first invested in Kry’s seed round. Since then Kry has become a European unicorn in the digital healthcare market.

successStories.quote: > "It’s not one big thing you will do in order to scale, but the addition of many, many small things that will make the difference."
successStories.summary: Project A was asked to help Kry become more efficient with performance marketing. Our marketing team jumped in and supported Kry to accelerate growth and set the foundation for scalability across markets.

successStories.quote: > "Whenever you encounter a problem with scaling your organization, you can count on Project A to have the right people to help you solve it."
successStories.summary: sennder is an incredible success story: The company became Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder in only a couple of years. Rising to the status of unicorn in 2021, we continue to support sennder, having invested early on at seed stage.

digital companies
that challenge the status quo of their industries. With over
of assets under management, we start with investments of
$1M to $8M

content.title: Customer engagement platform Dixa raises $105M Series C
content.headline: Customer engagement platform Dixa raises $105M Series C
content.contentMd:
__Berlin, 28.7.2021.__ Dixa, [the customer engagement platform](https://www.dixa.com/), raises a $105M Series C funding round led by General Atlantic, with existing investors Project A, Notion Capital and SEED Capital also participating. 

The Copenhagen-based company has created a customer experience solution which works across all channels and shifts away from transactional, ticket-based customer service to value-added customer engagement, beneficial for brands and customers alike. 

Dixa will leverage the new funds to invest in product development, including potential new acquisitions, having acquired Melbourne-based Elevio earlier this year.

__Uwe Horstmann__, General Partner at Project A, says: “High-quality, scalable customer service is one of the key challenges all digital brands face in retaining customer loyalty. Dixa has the ideal solution with its conversational customer service platform which delivers exceptional customer as well as agent experience across all channels. We are very proud to see that Dixa has grown tremendously since we first invested in its Series A in 2019 and continue to support their journey.”

Read why we first invested in Dixa’s Series A in 2019 [here](https://insights.project-a.com/why-we-invested-in-dixa-8ca41930f0de).

content.title: Project A launches UK office
content.headline: Project A launches in the UK and opens London office
content.contentMd:
- Project A Ventures today announces its UK launch, with its London office to be led by experienced investors Sam Cash, Jack Wang, and Luc de Leyritz. 
- The firm has been investing in the UK since 2012, and investment team members have been on the ground since 2019. UK companies WorldRemit, Electric Gamebox and Unmind are in the firm’s portfolio.
- UK companies in which Project A invests will be able to access the firm’s “Operational Model”. The firm employs the largest platform team in Europe, and offers support from over 100 functional experts. 

__London, 14 July 2021.__ Project A Ventures, the European early-stage venture firm headquartered in Berlin and backers of WorldRemit, Trade Republic, KRY, Unmind, Voi, Spryker, sennder and Catawiki has brought its “Operational VC” model to UK start-ups by opening its first international office in London.

Project A’s London office is headed by an experienced investment team including Principals Sam Cash, Jack Wang, and Associate Luc de Leyritz, supported by Leopold Lerach and Francesca Baillieu from Berlin. 

Project A has been present locally since early 2019 through Sam Cash, who joined the firm from betaworks to lead efforts locally. The team expansion is indicative of their commitment to the UK ecosystem, and demonstrates the firm’s willingness to build on the positive momentum it has in the UK, having invested in WorldRemit, Electric Gamebox, Quix and Unmind. 

The firm will continue to back pan-European founders at seed and Series A with its “Operational Model”. The model enables all of Project A’s portfolio companies to access a wide range of operational support services. This includes more than 100 functional experts across key areas such as software engineering, business intelligence, sales and marketing, recruitment and many more. The fund boasts the largest platform team in European venture capital. 

__Uwe Horstmann__, General Partner at Project A Ventures, “The UK has always been one of the world’s major technology hubs, and commands a significant portion of both capital and talent. We fully expect to see this trend continue, with talented employees coming out of large companies in increasing number, to embark on their own start-ups, supported by an abundance of venture capital in the market.” 

__Sam Cash__, Principal at Project A Ventures, “We’re expanding our presence in London for a few reasons. We want to give founders all the benefits of having a local partner, whilst allowing them to work with our operational team. London has been fertile ground for us in terms of our existing partnerships, the density of tech talent and the opportunity cost is now too great for global firms not to be here.”

__Nick Taylor__, CEO of Unmind, "Project A's operational approach offers something that most VCs cannot provide, a team of 100 functional experts who are able to support companies at a moment’s notice. Since partnering with them, their teams in London and Berlin have been invaluable in helping us manage our growth and scaling internationally.” 

Project A currently has $600 million under management investing across consumer, marketplaces, SaaS, deeptech, fintech / insurtech, mobility and gaming. Furthermore, Project A has already been backing amazing U.K. founders over the past years including WorldRemit, Unmind, Electric Gamebox, Quix, Wonderbly as well as a number of unannounced companies.

content.title: Project A co-invests in Perfect Drive Sports Group
content.headline: Project A co-invests in leading golf supplier Perfect Drive Sports Group
content.contentMd:
__Berlin, 5.7.2021.__ Project A co-invests in Perfect Drive Sports Group (PDSG), Europe’s largest eCommerce company for golf equipment. PDSG consolidates two brands under one roof – Clubhouse Golf in the UK and All4Golf in Germany. Hence the group is the leading online retailer of golf equipment in the UK and the German speaking region. Project A’s involvement in PDSG is a private equity co-investment, made in collaboration with [Bregal Unternehmerkapital](https://www.bregal.de/en/news/article/bregal-unternehmerkapital-acquires-perfect-drive-sports-group), which acquired a majority of PDSG earlier this year. 

__Ben Fischer__, General Partner at Project A, states: “The Perfect Drive Sport Group has shown strong growth in the highly fragmented European market for golf equipment. The Covid-19 pandemic has further changed the purchasing behaviour of golfers from offline to online, a development PDSG is well positioned for. With our operational model, Project A is able to support PDSG’s growth beyond the current markets and help them leverage their tech, data and marketing capabilities.”

The two PDSG brands are the largest distributors of golf equipment in their respective markets, following a direct-to-customer approach with a wide range of products and competent advisory services, from customisations to repairs. PDSG has more than 150 employees across its two locations in Hannover (All4Golf, founded in 1986) and Manchester (Clubhouse Golf, founded 2003).

content.title: Project A boosts early stage fundings, investing in  butter, Knowunity, priceloop and Quix
content.headline: Project A boosts early stage fundings, investing in butter, Knowunity, priceloop and Quix
content.contentMd:
__Berlin, 10.6.2021.__ Project A announces several new seed investments underlining its position as a leading early stage tech investor in Europe. The investments include the workplace collaboration platform __butter__, __Knowunity__ a learning platform for and by students, __priceloop__, a data driven pricing solution, and data streaming analytics platform __Quix__.

“Project A specializes in these pre-seed and seed rounds, investing early on in very promising tech ideas and strong founder teams displayed here by butter, Knowunity, priceloop and Quix. With our operational team, we can additionally support the growth of these companies and bridge any gaps that might arise in the early stage", says __Uwe Horstmann__, General Partner of Project A Ventures.

__About the investments__

__butter__ is an all-in-one workshop tool that allows facilitators to prepare, run and debrief their workshops and trainings all from one place. Equipped with different collaboration tools like Miro and Google Drive and presettable native tools like agenda, polls and breakouts, Butter allows facilitators to put their energy back into having delightful and collaborative sessions with ease. Co-founded by Jakob Knutzen, Christopher-Holm Hansen and Adam Wan, its mission is to make virtual workshops 10x better than live ones. Project A has invested in Butter’s $3.2M seed stage to help enable the Butter team to scale their product, business and user base. [butter.us](https://butter.us)

__Knowunity__ is the learning platform for and by students, enabling them to solve any learning problem in just one app. The Knowunity app includes more than 65,000 pieces of user generated learning content, such as summaries, learning aids or explanations - available free of charge in all topics and subjects. Experienced students can upload their content, help other students and build up a follower base with their knowledge. Knowunity is the fastest growing learning platform in Germany, with 1 million app downloads and ranking top 3 in the educational app charts. Project A leads the seed investment funding round of €2M. [knowunity.de](https://knowunity.de)

__priceloop__ enables eCommerce and retail companies to be more successful by using data-driven pricing decisions. The solution is based on a machine-learning model, which continuously learns and improves. The founders Dr. Richard Schwenke and Dat Tran have created a solution that is data-efficient and transparent from demand function to final price. [priceloop.ai](https://priceloop.ai)

__Quix__ is a real-time streaming analytics platform. Quix changes the way data is handled and processed - from a database centric approach to a stream centric approach, connecting Python developers to real time data streams. The company has an ambitious vision to ensure that any organisation, large or small, can quickly take advantage of and immediately act on their data insights at lower costs with a smaller environmental impact. The £2.3M seed round is led by Project A, with participation from Passion Capital and angel investors. [quix.ai](https://quix.ai)

Read in our [blog](https://insights.project-a.com/too-early-never-c2a1405dde89) why we focus on seed investments.

content.title: Trade Republic secures one of the largest European FinTech funding rounds
content.headline: Trade Republic secures one of the largest European FinTech funding rounds
content.contentMd:
__Berlin, 21.05.2021.__ Germany’s first commission free and mobile broker Trade Republic secures a __$900M Series C__ funding round to enable millions of Europeans to have easy, fast and free access to capital markets. Trade Republic’s valuation rises to __$5bn__ and the company now ranks among the most valuable European Fintech companies.

The investment round is led by Sequoia followed by TCV and Thrive. Existing investors Project A, Creandum, Founders Fund and Accel also invested in this round. Project A is one of Trade Republic’s early investors (Series A in 2019) and supported the company with its operational teams in various areas such as data infrastructure, IT development, recruiting, marketing and customer service.

__Florian Heinemann__, General Partner at Project A, says: “Trade Republic has the perfect product-market fit, opening a formerly exclusive asset class like ETFs to the broader public via mobile based commission-free approach. In the last two years, Trade Republic has become a model company in the German Fintech industry having gained an impressive foothold in further markets across Europe as well.”

Trade Republic has gained more than one million customers in Germany, France and Austria within 24 months. The online broker aims at helping millions of people across Europe close their pension gap by providing them the opportunity to invest money into capital markets with a mobile-first, secure and commission-free offering. The $900M Series C financing round is one of the largest venture funding rounds in financial services in Europe.

content.title: Portfolio: Hero
content.headline: Our portfolio companies are our heroes.

content.value: We have backed 70+ digital companies across 15 industries and 12 countries.

content.subheadline: We have backed 70+ digital companies across 15 industries and 12 countries.

initialItems.headline: Profian
initialItems.location:
Cambridge (United Kingdom)
Raleigh, North Carolina (United States)

content.value:
Profian is a security company, providing products and services in the Confidential
Computing space. The company is committed to open source software basing its products
on the open source software project Enarx, which uses WebAssembly, a portable run-time
binary format supported on all the major hardware platforms, and which is being
standardized by the W3C. Profian allows companies to deploy existing cloud-native
applications, without redesign or recompilation, across existing platforms like Intel SGX and
AMD SEV, and new platforms as they are rolled out, such as Arm 9 Realms and IBM Power
Series PEF.

Heyflow is the no-code software to build, design and integrate clickflows. We believe that user interaction is the most important activity on the web and that clickflows are the best way to achieve great interactions. That’s why we are dedicated to empowering businesses to convert more traffic with clickflows.

initialItems.headline: Perfect Drive Sports Group
initialItems.subheadline: Europe's leading online retailer of golf equipment

content.value: Perfect Drive Sports Group (PDSG) is Europe’s largest e-commerce company for golf equipment. It is the leading online retailer of golf equipment in the UK and the German speaking region. With its two brands – Clubhouse Golf in the UK and All4Golf in Germany – PDSG is going to accelerate its international expansion as well as further drive organic growth in its respective home markets through continued investments into the online offering and marketing capabilities. It stocks the majority of leading golf brands and offers a direct-to-customer proposition centred around a bigger choice for better value with an industry leading service. Across its two locations in Hannover and Manchester, the group has more than 150 employees.

initialItems.headline: AMAZD
initialItems.subheadline: Personal conversational storefront

content.value:
AMAZD is a personal conversational storefront solution that combines the same
interactive 1-1 service available from an in-store experience, with the convenience of
online shopping. Often customers have to spend time on tedious research, sifting
through incomplete product information to then be faced with the sheer agony of
choice. That’s why AMAZD is committed to helping customers make better
high-consideration purchase decisions with free personalized advice. While at the
same time enabling retailers to increase direct customer engagement, transactions,
and customer loyalty. AMAZD does this by virtually connecting customers with real
human product experts via a powerful app, giving businesses the power to transform
the customer journey into a highly engaging and personalized conversation via text,
chat, or video - with unlimited up and cross selling opportunities.

initialItems.headline: priceloop
initialItems.subheadline: Data driven pricing

content.value: priceloop enables eCommerce and retail companies to be more successful by using data-driven pricing decisions. The solution is based on a machine-learning model, which continuously learns and improves. The founders Dr. Richard Schwenke and Dat Tran have created a solution that is data-efficient and transparent from demand function to final price.

initialItems.headline: Quix
initialItems.subheadline: Data streaming analytics platform
initialItems.management:
Michael Rosam
Tomas Neubauer
Peter Nagy
Patrick Mira Pedrol

content.value: Quix

is a real-time streaming analytics platform. Quix changes the way data is handled and processed - from a database centric approach to a stream centric approach, connecting Python developers to real time data streams. The company has an ambitious vision to ensure that any organisation, large or small, can quickly take advantage of and immediately act on their data insights at lower costs with a smaller environmental impact. 

Read
why we invested
in Quix.

initialItems.headline: Inwerk
initialItems.subheadline: Professional office furniture

content.value: Inwerk is one of the leading online providers of professional office furniture in Germany. Inwerk was founded in 2001 and has 105 employees in two offices. The company, headquartered in Meerbusch near Düsseldorf, is a pioneer in online multi-channel marketing and an award-winning designer of unique and innovative office furnishing solutions. The company has served over 400,000 customers with a comprehensive product and service offering including own design furniture and 3D office planning services.

initialItems.headline: Knowunity
initialItems.subheadline: Learning platform by and for students

content.value: Knowunity

is the learning platform for and by students, enabling them to solve any learning problem in just one app. The Knowunity app includes more than 50,000 pieces of user generated learning content, such as summaries, learning aids or explanations - available free of charge in all topics and subjects. Experienced students can upload their content, help other students and build up a follower base with their knowledge.

initialItems.headline: butter
initialItems.subheadline: Smooth virtual workshops
initialItems.management:
Jakob Knutzen
Christopher Holm-Hansen
Adam Wan

content.value:
Butter is an all-in-one platform built with all the tools you need to host
interactive workshops, remote design sprints and brainstormings, virtual training sessions and live courses. It is browser-based and integrates common tools such as the Google Suite and Miro for better collaboration while bringing back a sense of freshness to Zoom-fatigued office workers.

initialItems.headline: WindStar Medical
initialItems.subheadline: Consumer Health Platform
initialItems.management:
René Flaschker
Bettina Silvester
Lukas Kretzinger

content.value: WindStar Medical is a leading over-the-counter (OTC) consumer healthcare company based in Germany. The WindStar Medical Group develops companies in the extended healthcare market. The company creates and distributes high-quality consumer health products and brands for drugstores, supermarkets and online. The group's business units are supported during their development and in their international expansion. WindStar Medical focuses on quickly and consistently building upmarket leaders, who can assert themselves in their markets as independent companies.

initialItems.headline: GartenHaus
initialItems.subheadline: Leading online shop for home and garden projects

content.value: GartenHaus GmbH is the leading online platform for home and garden projects. Founded in 2002, GartenHaus GmbH sells garden houses, sheds, carports, terraces, saunas and other garden and home related products via their local online shops. With 1 million monthly users it is the digital market leader for home and garden projects in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and the Netherlands. The digital specialist has developed an innovative online shop including price comparison and unique and rich media content for a product range of 30,000 SKU and services. On request, GartenHaus GmbH handles the entire garden and home project, from A to Z: assembly, consultation, planning permission, foundations, maintenance and accessories. The extensive range of services includes products made to measure and configurators allowing customers to design products individually.

initialItems.headline: Pactum
initialItems.subheadline: AI Negotiation Platform Company
initialItems.management:
Kaspar Korjus
Martin Rand
Kristjan Korjus

content.value: Pactum is an AI-based system that helps global companies to automatically offer personalized, commercial negotiations on a massive scale. The system adds value and saves time for both the Pactum client and their negotiation partner by aligning their values to determine win-win agreements via an easy-to-use chat interface that implements best-practice negotiation strategies. The company is based in Mountain View with engineering and operations in Estonia. Pactum is backed by founders of Skype and TransferWise and built by luminaries from Skype, Starship Technologies and the Government of Estonia’s e-Residency program.
Read
why we invested
in Pactum.

initialItems.headline: Evernest
initialItems.subheadline: Redefining real estate sales – helping people find a home for life
initialItems.management:
Christian Evers
Luisa Haxel
Stefan Betzold

content.value: Evernest redefines the buying and selling of residential real estate in Europe's major cities. They offer brokers and their customers a unique platform that allows for a transparent, seamless, and personalized experience. They bring together the brightest minds in tech and real estate and combine start-up culture with years of industry expertise.

initialItems.headline: Amann Girrbach
initialItems.subheadline: Manufacturers of CAD/CAM Equipment and Material for Dental Labs & Dentists
initialItems.management:
Dr. Wolfgang Reim (CEO)
Jörg Mayer
Eelco De Groot

content.value:
Amann Girrbach sets new standards in digital dental technology. As a pioneer in dental CAD/CAM technology Amann Girrbach AG is one of the leading innovators and preferred full-service providers in digital dental prosthetics. With its high degree of expertise in development and commitment to customer orientation, the ambitious company from Vorarlberg, Austria, creates sophisticated system solutions for tomorrow's practice routine.

The company Girrbach Dental Germany was founded in 1936 by Herbert Girrbach, Amann Dental Austria was established in 1972. After many years of a successful cooperation, the two firms were merged into Amann Girrbach AG in the year 2004. The company employs more than 500 people around the world in 6 different countries: Austria, Germany, USA, Singapore, Brasil and China.

initialItems.headline: Unmind
initialItems.subheadline: The workplace mental health platform
initialItems.management:
Nick Taylor
Nick Tong
Steve Peralta

content.value: Unmind offers a workplace mental health platform that empowers employees to proactively measure and manage their mental health through scientifically-backed assessments, tools, training and signposting. They enable organizations to access aggregated and anonymous data, allowing them to make informed decisions about their wider mental health strategy. Unmind is built on the belief that everyone has the right to a healthy mind. Their vision is to create a world where mental health is universally understood, nurtured and celebrated. They work with the world’s top clinicians, academics and authors; combining the latest research from positive psychology, cognitive behavioural therapy, neuroscience, and mindfulness.

initialItems.headline: Anyline
initialItems.subheadline: The Mobile Text Recognition For Mobile Apps

content.value:
Founded in Vienna in 2013, Anyline has established itself as a market leader in mobile data
capture. Using the newest and most innovative artificial intelligence approaches, Anyline
enables any mobile device to process written characters and barcodes in real time, even when
offline. Anyline mobile data capture technology is CCPA/GDPR compliant, processing all data collected securely on the users’ device, and removing any chance of data interference. It’s not only more accurate than manual data entry, but also works 20 times faster. These scanning solutions are trusted by household brands such as PepsiCo, Discount Tire and IBM, as well as national governments and the United Nations.
Read why we invested in Anyline
here

initialItems.headline: Electric Gamebox
initialItems.subheadline: Digital Entertainment Platform

content.value: Electric Gamebox is a new genre of group entertainment offering immersive Adventures in interactive digital rooms. Their custom developed LightBox Adventure pods host up to six players at a time and feature a range of technologies including projection mapping, touch screens, motion tracking and surround sound. This cutting-edge tech delivers a hyper-immersive, interactive group experience for all – without any bulky headsets.

Teams of 1-6 play 30-60 minute adventures featuring games and challenges designed to be fun, social and collaborative. The first location opened on London’s Southbank in October 2019, where players can pick from two different Adventures, with more being added on a regular basis in the coming months. Tickets start at £20.

initialItems.headline: Trade Republic
initialItems.subheadline: Germany's first mobile and commission-free broker
initialItems.management:
Christian Hecker
Thomas Pischke
Marco Cancellieri

content.value: Trade Republic Bank is Germany’s first mobile-only and commission-free broker.

Trade Republic is on a mission to set millions of Europeans up for wealth creation with secure, easy and free access to capital markets. With over one million customers Trade Republic is already the home screen app for many Europeans to manage their wealth. It offers commission-free investing in equities and crypto as well as free ETF and fractional stock savings plans. Trade Republic is a technology company with a German banking license supervised by Bundesbank and BaFin. As Europe’s largest NeoBroker Trade Republic has received investments by Accel, Creandum, Founders Fund, Project A, Sequoia, TCV, and Thrive Capital. The company based in Berlin was founded in 2015 by Christian Hecker, Thomas Pischke, and Marco Cancellieri and employs more than 400 people.
Read why we invested in Trade Republic
here

initialItems.headline: Carl
initialItems.subheadline: Europe’s leading M&A platform for the mid-market

content.value: Carl is an M&A platform for SMEs, connecting owners, advisors, and acquirers around opportunities from €1mn to €50mn in transaction value. Carl’s private deal network, a dedicated SaaS solution that guides the process and partnerships with numerous associations, banks, and more than 220 M&A advisors, connects more than 2,500 accredited buyers to interesting companies. Carl’s mission is to offer the “Mittelstand” the same access to professional and efficient M&A services that large cooperations have had access to since long ago.
Read why we invested in
Carl

initialItems.headline: Laserhub
initialItems.subheadline: Platform for individual sheet metal parts
initialItems.management:
Adrian Raidt
Christoph Rößner
Jonas Schweizer

content.value: Laserhub has developed a vertically integrated, multi-vendor procurement platform for individual sheet metal parts. The start-up fully automatically links the demands of the customers with the resources of the providers. This reduces both process and parts costs as well as the order and processing time. Orders from the fields of laser cutting, bending / folding and further processing can be implemented via the platform. Laserhub takes care of the entire process: from automatic offer preparation to order placement, implementation, logistics, and billing.
Read
why we invested
in Laserhub.

initialItems.headline: VOI
initialItems.subheadline: Shared electric scooters for Europe’s streets
initialItems.management:
Fredrik Hjelm
Douglas Stark
Adam Jafer
Filip Lindvall

content.value: Shared electric scooters for Europe’s streets

Voi is a Swedish e-scooter startup creating a system of electrically powered scooters around urban centers. The company's goal is to provide an affordable, sustainable, and exhilarating way to commute while helping people to reduce their carbon footprint and cities to have a more sustainable transportation network.
Read
why we invested
in Voi.

initialItems.headline: Dixa
initialItems.subheadline: The customer friendship platform

content.value: Dixa is a customer engagement platform that creates value for brands and customers in a conversational, friendly, and engaging way called Customer Friendship™. Established in Copenhagen, Denmark in 2015, Dixa was founded on the principle that there must be a better way to do customer service, one that allowed the creation of value-driven experiences for customers as well as empowered agents to do more than ticketing for the business. In February of 2021, the company acquired the Australian knowledge platform startup, Elevio to empower agents as well as customers with AI-optimized knowledge base and contextual experiences.

Dixa has expanded globally within the first years since launch and now has offices in Copenhagen, London, New York, Berlin, Kyiv, Tel Aviv and Melbourne. The company doubled its revenues YoY, and has raised more than $155 million in funding to date with backing from Notion Capital, Project A Ventures, SEED Capital and recently from General Atlantic.
Read why we invested in Dixa
here

initialItems.headline: Casavo
initialItems.subheadline: First Italian iBuyer - sell your home within 30 days!

content.value: Casavo’s mission is to make buying and selling residential property as simple and pleasant as possible.

Casavo is a Proptech startup operating in the real estate sector that developed an innovative and unique business model: a technological platform (Instant Buyer) that submits offers to buy homes to sellers, and after renovation finds the final buyers. Founded in Milan in 2017
by Giorgio Tinacci, Casavo has the mission to change the way people sell, live and buy homes in Europe. The company has handled more than 1100 real estate transactions to date for a total value in excess of €300 million. With a team of 200 people, Casavo is currently
operating in Milan, Rome, Turin, Florence, Bologna, Verona, and Madrid. With its core being the Instant Buyer service, Casavo has further expanded its marketplace product offer to cover all the needs of sellers, buyers and brokers.
Read why we invested in Casavo
here

initialItems.headline: micropsi industries
initialItems.subheadline: Machine learning for industrial robots
initialItems.management:
Dominik Welland
Priska Herger
Ronnie Vuine

content.value: A robotics software company headquartered in Germany, micropsi industries is driving the future of industrial automation. Its unique control system, Mirai, applies artificial intelligence technologies to create flexible, real- time controlled robotic applications for use in dynamic environments and execute complex tasks. Mirai learns by rehearsing movements from humans guiding the robot and trains them within hours vs. days of creating complicated programming that other systems require. Its technology is designed for global electronics assembly and manufacturing industries and works with hardware platforms such as ABB and Universal Robots. To learn more, please visit micropsi-industries.com.

initialItems.headline: trendtours
initialItems.subheadline: Travelling done right for best agers
initialItems.management:
David Firle
Christian Holz
Markus Daldrup

content.value:
trendtours is one of the leading German direct tour operators.
The company offers air, bus and boat trips as well as cure, adventure and recreational holidays and caters to an older target group aged 55 and above. So far these offers are used by approximately 400,000 customers per year. Project A, together with Bregal, invested and thus arranged the succession of the founder Werner Scheidel. As an operative co-investor, Project A will support the business of trendtours especially in the digital transformation of the company.

initialItems.headline: AZOWO
initialItems.subheadline: The mobility platform for fleet management and mobility sharing
initialItems.management:
Albert Pescheck
Peter Jegutzki
Patric Schneider

content.value: AZOWO provides a B2B mobility platform to manage and optimize vehicle fleets. With its flexible, cloud-based fleet management software and mobility sharing solution, AZOWO enables efficient management and effective optimization of fleets and vehicle pools. The solution provides the highest data transparency, automated processes, and sound statistics and reports. AZOWO, which headquartered in Biberach (Germany), has been founded in 2015 by Peter Jegutzki, Andreas Kopf, and Patric Schneider.

initialItems.headline: Sennder
initialItems.subheadline: Logistics for full truck loads
initialItems.management:
Julius Köhler
David Nothacker
Nicolaus Schefenacker

content.value: sennder GmbH is a digital road-freight-forwarder, headquartered in Berlin. The company connects shippers with carriers through an inhouse developed platform. Offering its partners a 360° full service, sennder’s software provides real time bookings as well as precise live tracking, resulting in greater transparency of the logistics supply chain. sennder was founded in 2015 by Nicolaus Schefenacker, David Nothacker, and Julius Köhler.

initialItems.headline: Artisense
initialItems.subheadline: Second to none in AI powered computer vision
initialItems.management:
Dr. Daniel Cremers
Till Kaestner
Andrej Kulikov

content.value: Founded by renowned researchers, industry experts, and company builders, Artisense develops AI-based computer vision solutions for vehicle automation and robotics. Based on dynamic 3D maps, which are combined in an Internet of Vehicles, Artisense’s technology enables navigation of autonomous vehicles without GPS or expensive sensors and hardware. As a spin-off of the chair of Prof. Daniel Cremers of the Technical University of Munich, Artisense builds on 10 years of research and cooperation with leading OEM, T1, and technology companies.

initialItems.headline: Aula
initialItems.subheadline: Digital infrastructure for education

content.value: Aula is a communication platform built for education that replaces emails and learning management systems (e.g. Moodle, Canvas, Blackboard, D2L) with digital infrastructure designed to encourage interaction and engagement. Aula was founded at the University of Oxford by Anders Krohn, Oliver Nicolini and Adrian Franklin who were driven to build Aula based on their experiences as students at universities across the globe. The institutional version of Aula was launched in September 2017 and early adopter universities include Ravensbourne, the University of Nottingham, the Royal College of Art and the University of Derby. Aula brings together students, staff, and educators — think of it as an institution’s digital campus.

initialItems.headline: Peergrade
initialItems.subheadline: Learn by giving feedback
initialItems.management:
David Kofoed Wind
Malthe Jørgensen
Simon Lind

content.value: Peergrade is an EdTech startup that gives students a better learning experience with faster and more thorough feedback from their peers. Peer grading offers a way to dramatically reduce the time teachers spent on grading while increasing the quantity of the feedback. Students hand in their work and give feedback to each other. This way students get much more feedback without extra work for the teachers.Through their platform teachers can also get insights into student performance over time based on data. Most importantly, reading and providing feedback on other's assignments is an excellent learning opportunity.Based in Copenhagen, Peergrade was founded in 2015 by David Kofoed Wind, Malthe Jørgensen, and Simon Lind.

initialItems.headline: Opinary
initialItems.subheadline: Making opinions matter
initialItems.management:
Cornelius Frey
Max Meran
Pia Frey

content.value: Opinary is a Berlin-based startup that has established a new way for users to share their opinions in online content. The startup was founded 2015 by the siblings Pia and Cornelius Frey and their Co-Founder Max Meran to help more than 70 million monthly users to share their view with a tap and understand opinion trends at a glance.

Opinary visualizes debates by creating highly engaging content for users. With their algorithm and semantic targeting, they guarantee a scalable integration of needed topics in all thematically relevant articles within large publisher networks in Germany, the UK, and the US. The platform offers users the opportunity to engage with interactive content that gives users a voice, helping publishers and brands reach, understand and convert their most valuable audiences.
Publishing partners – including global leaders like The Times, HuffPost, NBC etc., use Opinary to engage and monetize their audiences, while global brands like Toyota or Mastercard boost attention, create conversions and generate insights.

initialItems.headline: LUQOM Group
initialItems.subheadline: Europe's leading e-commerce platform for lighting fixtures
initialItems.management:
Jochen Wilms (CEO)
Dr. Oliver Merz (Co-CEO & CFO)
Thomas Rebmann
Erik Jansen
Morten Brændgaard

content.value: LUQOM GROUP is the leading e-commerce platform for lighting fixtures in Europe. The company operates across the entire value chain of the lighting industry and provides over 500 suppliers with direct access to private (B2C) and commercial (B2B) customers across 27 countries. LUQOM GROUP combines a supplier and retail partner network with five logistics centres, as well as three online shops and private label brands. LUQOM GROUP includes the well-established online shops of Lampenwelt (Germany), QLF (Benelux) and Lampemesteren (Denmark).

initialItems.headline: Comtravo
initialItems.subheadline: AI booking platform for business travel

content.value: Comtravo makes booking and managing business trips as simple as sending an email.

Comtravo’s software translates text requests such as email into structured queries using natural language processing (NLP) and artificial intelligence technology to provide the best travel options for individual travelers based on specified preferences as well as previous booking behavior. This way, users can quickly book personalized offers with one click directly in the email.

Comtravo was founded in July 2015 by Michael Riegel, Jannik Neumann, Marko Schilde and Slobodan Utvic together with a highly experienced team of travel and tech veterans. By now, Comtravo is employing a team of 45 people, half of it focusing on their AI technology and the product. More than 200 companies, mainly headquartered in Germany, are already working with Comtravo, e.g. Hellofresh, Viessmann or Fexcom.

initialItems.headline: misterb&b
initialItems.subheadline: The largest gay hotelier in the world
initialItems.management:
Matthieu Jost
Marc Dedonder
François de Landes
Chris Sinton

content.value: Founded in 2014 by Matthieu Jost, Marc Dedonder, François de Landes and Chris Sinton, misterb&b is the world’s largest marketplace connecting like-minded travellers and hosts in the LGBT community. They are able to list, discover and book welcoming accommodations worldwide with 100,000 hosts in over 135 countries. misterb&b will further pursue its global approach to bringing gay men and women together in real-life experiences while expanding its operations in Paris, Los Angeles and Lima. misterb&b’s free app is available on iOS, Android and the web.

initialItems.headline: Gabi
initialItems.subheadline: Insurance rate monitoring service
initialItems.management:
Hanno Fichtner
Krzysztof Kujawa
Vincenz Klemm
Pawel Olszewski

content.value: Gabi is a personal insurance platform that ensures customers always have the right coverage at the best price. Gabi has launched in CA in January 2017 and is backed by A Capital, Project A, SV Angel and a group of angels. It was founded in 2016 by Hanno Fichtner, Krzysztof Kujawa, Vincenz Klemm and Pawel Olszewski.

initialItems.headline: HelloPrint
initialItems.subheadline: Online print platform

content.value: Founded in 2013, Helloprint’s platform business is expanding rapidly into the European market. Currently, over 150.000 customers in the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Italy, United Kingdom, Spain, Germany and Ireland are ordering their printed products via the platform. Via a network of hundreds of international print and promotional producing partners over 2.000 unique printed products are available for its customers, anywhere and when they need it. The company operates from Rotterdam, The Netherlands, where it has its European HQ, and from Valencia, Spain, where the international Customer Experience Center is located.

initialItems.headline: Onlineprinters
initialItems.subheadline: High quality online printed products
initialItems.management:
Roland Keppler (CEO)
Dirk A. Müller (CFO)
Christian Würst (CCO)

content.value: Onlineprinters GmbH is one of Europe's leading online print providers. In line with the motto "Print simply online!" the company sells printed products to 500,000 customers in 30 European countries through its 15 web shops. Internationally, the company is known under the brand name "Onlineprinters"; in Germany it operates under the name "diedruckerei.de". The product range comprises 1,400 printed products from business cards, stationery and flyers to catalogues, brochures and large-format advertising systems. The formula to successfully produce customised prints in terms of Industry 4.0 rests on three pillars: online sales, fully integrated production from ordering to shipping and gang run printing. The latter uses so-called combined forms to collectively produce print jobs, therefore minimising costs and reducing the environmental impact. Selected products allow customers to choose the option of same day printing (produced on the same working day), overnight delivery, climate neutral production and custom size specification. Onlineprinters GmbH employs a staff of 600 and produces over two billion printings per year.

initialItems.headline: Keatz
initialItems.subheadline: The virtual restaurant chain for fresh and healthy food

content.value: Keatz (former GuruCollectiv) is a virtual restaurant chain delivering healthy foods such as salads, quinoa bowls, yogurts, mueslis and cold pressed juices. The company's goal is to become the leading household and office brand for on-demand fast casual delivery food. Keatz exclusively focuses on fresh salads and other ready-to-eat snacks, which are delivered through ecofriendly electric scooters. Keatz was founded in January 2016 by Paul Gebhardt and Dimitrios Ploutarchos.

initialItems.headline: Kry
initialItems.subheadline: European leader in digital healthcare, providing patients with the means to see a doctor, nurse or psychologist via video or chat

content.value: Kry is the European leader in digital healthcare, providing patients with the means to see a doctor, nurse or psychologist via video or chat on their smartphone or tablet. Kry also combines digital with physical care transforming how millions of patients access

healthcare. Since launching in early 2015, Kry has completed over 3 million patient meetings. Backed by some of the world’s most renowned tech investors including CPP Investments, Fidelity Management & Research LLC, Index Ventures, Accel, the Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan (Ontario Teachers’), Creandum and Project A, Kry is leading the field of digital health to reimagine the future of healthcare. Headquartered in Stockholm, Kry’s 600+ employees and 6000+ clinicians are committed to improving the world’s health through innovation, one patient at a time. Kry operates in Sweden, Norway and most recently Germany and also operates under the name Livi in the UK and France.

initialItems.headline: Klara
initialItems.subheadline: The healthcare messaging platform

content.value: Klara was founded in 2013 with the vision to change the broken healthcare experience by directly connecting doctors and patients through technology. Klara’s secure and HIPAA-compliant medical messaging platform allows providers and patients to centralize all their medical communication in one simple and secure app. Doctors and their teams can collaboratively treat and communicate with their patients, adding external providers and other medical partners (such as pharmacies, labs and insurance companies) to the conversation to streamline patient care. Klara has been founded in 2013 by Simon Bolz und Dr. Simon Lorenz with offices in New York and Berlin.

initialItems.headline: store2be
initialItems.subheadline: Targeted, measurable and scalable live communication
initialItems.management:
Dr. Marlon Braumann
Peter Gundel
Emil Kabisch
Sven Wissebach

content.value: store2be provides companies and agencies interested in advertising their goods or services with the possibility to book measurable and scalable live communication directed precisely at target groups. With a couple of clicks, spaces for advertisements and promotional actions in shopping centres and at independent retailers, institutes of higher education, cinemas and events can be leased temporarily on store2be.com. In addition, store2be offers the possibility to book additional services such as help with setting up stands, logistical assistance or even personnel. All of the important elements for successful live communication can thus be obtained all in one convenient package from a single provider. In the process, store2be makes appropriate recommendations for its customers’ needs regarding frequency and target groups. Over 1,000 spaces all across Germany are already available for booking through store2be.com today. store2be.com is managed by WHU alumni Dr. Marlon Braumann and Sven Wissebach and KIT graduates Emil Kabisch and Peter Gundel. store2be was founded in 2015 in the context of the Karlsruhe-based incubator CyberLab and has been officially headquartered in Berlin since summer 2016.

initialItems.headline: Homeday
initialItems.subheadline: Data-driven real estate divestment
initialItems.management:
Steffen Wicker
Dmitri Uvarovski
Philipp Reichle
Friederike Hesse

content.value:
Selling and buying real estate is getting easy and convenient: Homeday defines the new quality standards in real estate. Homeday combines in-depth market intelligence with daily updated data on market conditions,and pricing; and innovative technologies with professional, personal advice. Homeday experts develop tailor-made marketing strategies that perfectly fit the object and the people behind it.
In 2014 Homeday was founded by Steffen Wicker, Dmitri Uvarovski and Philipp Reichle. Today a team of more than 60 employees supports sellers and buyers; from the intention to sell to signing the contract throughout the whole process.
Read
why we invested
in Homeday.

initialItems.headline: Qunomedical
initialItems.subheadline: Medical treatments abroad
initialItems.management:
Dr. Sophie Chung
Dr. Sebastian Glöckner

content.value: Qunomedical is a medical travel provider that helps patients worldwide to find high-quality care abroad at an affordable price. The Berlin-based startup was founded in 2015 and enables patients to get offers from clinics for almost any kind of treatment and to choose the most suitable offer with ease. The company only cooperates with renowned clinics and hospitals which adhere to the highest certification standards and which are highly experienced in dealing with international patients. Qunomedical’s passionate team of experts is led by Doctor Sophie Chung.

initialItems.headline: Wonderbly
initialItems.subheadline: Personalized storytelling for kids

content.value: Wonderbly is an award winning publishing startup that plays in the intersection of storytelling and technology. Wonderbly is on a mission to inspire boundless self-belief in children through clever and sophisticated personalization. The company is building a new class of global publishing business that brings millions of people into our superbly high quality products - as creators and audiences - and in doing so empowers them to build connections with each other and with us.

initialItems.headline: kfzteile24
initialItems.subheadline: The address for car parts and accessories

content.value: kfzteile24 is a Berlin-based multichannel retailer in the field of car parts and accessories which provides car parts for hobbyists and professionals alike. The company generates most of its revenue via their online shops www.kfzteile24.de and www.autoteile24.de. In addition to their online shops, they run three chain stores with attached workshops in Berlin. kfzteile24 was founded in 2001 by Matthias Kieper and Torsten Hainke.

initialItems.headline: CrossEngage
initialItems.subheadline: The customer engagement platform for cross-channel marketing and CRM

content.value: CrossEngage is the Customer Data and Prediction Platform for growing marketers’ customer base into valuable, individual customer relationships. CrossEngage offesr a seamlessly integrated solution for handling user behavior and predictions that smartly leverages the power of your first-party customer data using best-in-class artificial intelligence (AI) and automated machine learning (AutoML). With almost 60 employees, CrossEngages works in Berlin and Hamburg. The customers include Deutsche Bahn, FOND OF, Peek & Cloppenburg, Scout 24, and Depot.

initialItems.headline: Liqid
initialItems.subheadline: Data-driven platform for private wealth management

content.value: At the core of LIQID is an intuitive digital platform. LIQID combines the competence, instruments and conditions of exclusive family offices, which up until now have been reserved for ultra-high net worth individuals alone, and makes them available to the target group of successful entrepreneurs and wealthy individuals of a new generation. The company’s investment strategies for digital and mobile use were developed together with HQ Trust, the renowned multi-family office of the Harald Quandt Family. The company LIQID Investments GmbH was established in February 2015 by an internationally experienced five-member founding team, which includes media manager and entrepreneur Christian Schneider-Sickert as well as manager and private banker Dr. Kyros Khadjavi.

initialItems.headline: PETS DELI
initialItems.subheadline: Fresh and natural pet food for cats and dogs

content.value: Pets Deli, the Berlin-based multichannel pet food brand, has the mission to deliver fresh and healthy pet food for caring pet owners. All products, like basic food, supplements, snacks and dried meat, are 100% food-grade quality, natural and species-appropriate. Besides their webshop, Pets Deli runs two stationary shops in Berlin. The company was founded in January 2014 by David Spanier and David Reinecke.

initialItems.headline: Horizn Studios
initialItems.subheadline: E-Commerce luggage brand
initialItems.management:
Stefan Holwe
Jan Hendrik Roosen
Margarete Schellong

content.value: Horizn Studios is an online-first travel brand headquartered in Berlin. Their team of engineers and designers develops innovative travel products and services for the digital age. From the brand’s iconic range of smart luggage to its innovative travel essentials and services, each product is designed to help you travel with ease and joy. Launched in 2015 by Stefan Holwe and Jan Roosen, Horizn is Europe’s leading luggage brand for the next generation.

initialItems.headline: Coureon
initialItems.subheadline: Worldwide shipping for merchants

content.value: Coureon Logistics is a new digital logistics provider for national & international parcel shipping. The Coureon platform combines multiple 3rd party logistics fleets into a unique network. Online merchants, SMEs, and enterprise clients can ship to over 190 destinations and save between 20% and 50% on their shipping costs, without any upfront investment and with just one integration. The company cooperates with over 100 logistics players worldwide. Coureon was founded in 2015 by Federico Frascà in Berlin.

initialItems.headline: ESV Digital Brazil
initialItems.subheadline: Digital marketing agency and global technology provider

content.value: ESV Digital Brazil employs a team of cross-channel analysts and program managers who use the comprehensive inhouse technology ESV platform to manage clients’ accounts and support technology licensees. It combines tracking, reporting, and bid management in one platform alongside a suite of power-tools such as automated campaign analysis, mass updates, catalogue methodology, raw request. The platform is a tool for any paid search marketer trying to leverage maximum benefit from paid search. Headquartered in Paris, with offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Ann Arbor, Madrid, Milan, Oslo, Bertrange and now São Paulo, ESV Digital Group employees over 200 digital marketing professionals who are working with more than 250 clients.

ESV Digital Brazil is part of ESV Digital Group and was launched in January 2014 by its founders and managing directors Alexa Gaspar and Mariana Oliveira. The digital marketing agency and global technology provider offers expertise in Digital Marketing Strategies and traffic acquisition through paid search, performance display, social media, mobile advertising and many others tatics. In June 2014, they merged with the Brazilian RTB display advertising agency Adtrade, that was founded in July 2013 by Robson del Fiol and Fernando Galender.

initialItems.headline: Spryker Systems
initialItems.subheadline: Commerce OS - more than a shop system

content.value: Spryker Systems provides the proprietary commerce framework Spryker, a customizable and scalable solution for corporations. The company was founded in November 2014 by Nils Seebach and Alexander Graf as a Joint Venture with Project A Ventures. Based on PHP architecture and with its modular approach, Spryker enables retailers to quickly adapt, scale and innovate their digital business. Individual requirements can easily be integrated in order to meet customer needs, including data driven approaches in the fields of Business Intelligence, CRM, and Online Marketing. Spryker has been developed under the leadership of Project A's CTO Fabian Wesner as well as co-founder and Managing Director Dr. Florian Heinemann. The framework has been deployed for numerous successful e-commerce businesses such as Tirendo, nu3 or Contorion.

initialItems.headline: ProCompra
initialItems.subheadline: B2B lead generation platform

content.value: ProCompra is a marketplace connecting providers and buyers of premium services & products with the mission to facilitate purchase decisions for SMEs in Brazil. As a B2B lead generation platform, ProCompra provides buyers with three offers from independent local suppliers. This allows more qualified purchasing decision. ProCompra was founded in September 2014 as an incubation project of Project A Ventures Latam.

initialItems.headline: Treatwell
initialItems.subheadline: Marketplace for hair and beauty treatments
initialItems.management:
Maarten Engelen
Laurens Groenendijk
Erik Wienk
Martijn Rozendaal
Jan Willem van Boeckel

content.value: With over 2,500 connected spas and salons in more than 50 cities in The Netherlands, Belgium and Germany, Treatwell is the biggest and fastest growing online marketplace for hair and beauty services in Continental Europe. The company was established by five co-founders, went live in October 2013, and has seen month-on-month growth of 20%. Treatwell allows consumers to search, compare and book treatments via its website or app, and offers spas and salons a free lightweight SaaS solution to help support new and loyal customers in their user experience.
Exited in June 2015 to Wahanda (€ 34 million)

initialItems.headline: Catawiki
initialItems.subheadline: Curated online auctions for exceptional objects
initialItems.management:
Ravi Vora
Frederik de Beer
Tyler Miller

content.value: Catawiki is a global online auction platform which unites buyers and sellers of special objects and collectibles in a unique way.

The company was founded in 2008 by a Dutch comic book collector and a Dutch developer as a community for collectors. Since 2011, Catawiki has been hosting weekly auctions for special objects, from comic books to classic cars and everything in between. In-house experts curate every auction, guaranteeing varied, high-quality selections of auction lots. Catawiki's unique payment system also provides buyers and sellers with a secure and simple means of transaction. With millions of visitors from across the world every month, Catawiki is the most trusted place for selling high-quality and hard-to-find objects online.

initialItems.headline: Intelipost
initialItems.subheadline: Logistics gateway for e-commerce

content.value: Intelipost is a Software as a Service company based in São Paulo, Brazil. With its Logistics Gateway API it connects e-commerce businesses to all main Brazilian logistics providers. In its unique platform, the company integrates the comparison and quotation of various transportation options as well as delivery tracking. Generating insights through automated Business Intelligence solutions Intelipost provides real time updates on freight costs, average delivery times and the overall quality score of the different providers. Thus it enables its customers to manage the entire delivery process and to optimize the logistics costs and efficiency of their operations. Intelipost was founded in March 2014 by CEO Stefan Rehm and Gabriel Drummond.

initialItems.headline: Loopline Systems
initialItems.subheadline: Lightweight Cloud Solution For Managing Performance Reviews

content.value: Loopline Systems offers a lightweight SaaS solution which is easy to implement and provides ongoing, actionable insights for executives and employees by linking data on performance with personal potential and contentment. By means of guided processes, loopline fosters individual commitment, enabling high-quality feedback and development. The Berlin-based company was founded in 2014. The founders Nora Heer and Christian Kaller were no strangers to the challenges attached to setting up a top notch performance-development tool for the enterprise market on the organizational and individual level: Combining more than ten years of HR experience with a background in entrepreneurial, technology-driven companies as well as leading corporations. In startups and small companies loopline drives professional maturing of HR, while dynamizing performance development in larger organizations.

initialItems.headline: Contorion
initialItems.subheadline: Parts for pros: The one-stop shop for MRO parts
initialItems.management:
Dr. Frederick Roehder
Dr. Richard Schwenke
Tobias Tschötsch

content.value: Contorion is an online store for industrial and trade supply. The extensive assortment covers a wide range of product categories, from screws to electrical and hand tools to work clothes of many renowned manufacturers. With high user-friendliness, a professional customer service and short delivery times Contorion would like to be the one-stop shop for business and private customers. The company was founded by Dr. Frederick Roehder, Dr. Richard Schwenke and Tobias Tschötsch in Berlin in the spring of 2014.
Exited in June 2017 to Hoffmann SE.

initialItems.headline: WorldRemit
initialItems.subheadline: International online money transfer service
initialItems.management:
Breon Corcoran (CEO)
Ismail Ahmed (Founder, Executive Chairman)

content.value: WorldRemit is an online service that lets people send money to friends and family living abroad, using a computer, smartphone or tablet. It is a convenient, low-cost alternative to traditional money transfer companies that use high street agents and charge unreasonable fees. Money can be received as a bank deposit, cash pick-up, Mobile Money, or mobile airtime top-up. WorldRemit’s service is available to senders in 50 countries. It offers transfers to more than 140 destinations across Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia and the Americas.

initialItems.headline: ZenMate
initialItems.subheadline: Surfing the internet encrypted and securely

content.value: ZenMate is the first product by ZenGuard, a startup based in Berlin. The company wants to improve internet security for its users and make it accessible to the general public. The browser add-on ZenMate’s functionality, is similar to a VPN connection and can be added with just one click. Once installed, ZenMate encrypts browser traffic, unlocks geo-restrictions and hides the original IP in order to protect the user’s privacy and identity. Because of its easy handling and advanced functionality, the plugin provides home network, WiFi and en route security. ZenMate is available on multiple browser platforms (Chrome, Opera, Firefox), as an app (android, iOS) and desktop version (Win, Mac), and therefore offers secure protection in any situation. Under the „ZenMate“ brand there are additional products available, for example the web firewall ZenMate Pulse and the mobile security solution ZenMate Sense. Altogether this offers a complete protection portfolio to its end clients. Zenguard was founded in 2013 by CEOs Simon Specka and Markus Hänel in Manchester and belongs to the first funding round of Axel Springer’s Plug and Play programs.

initialItems.headline: Kyto
initialItems.subheadline: Supporting medium enterprises in optimizing their online B2B presence

content.value: Kyto is a Software as a Service company, which supports small and medium enterprises in optimizing and increasing their international online B2B presence. The proprietary platform synchronizes entered company and product data with a global network of business directories, market places, and search engines. In this way Kyto allows its customers to generate more leads and sales online in a cost and time efficient way. Kyto is supported by recognized investors and experts, and has established a strong network of international publishing partners, such as Europages, IndustryStock, EC21 and more. Kyto is headquartered in Berlin and was founded in May 2013 by Dr. Martin Mittermeier and Paul Wulff.

initialItems.headline: Minodes
initialItems.subheadline: Data analysis for offline retailers

content.value: Minodes is an innovative SaaS solution for retail stores to increase sales performance and sustainably improve customer's shopping experience. Retailers may use the platform in various ways, for example to measure and optimize marketing campaigns and shop window designs, or develop targeted, location-based marketing activities. The Minodes campaign tool allows retailers to act directly upon the generated insights. Minodes GmbH was founded in 2013, based in Berlin, the Managing Directors are Tim Wegner and Alexander Köth.

initialItems.headline: evino
initialItems.subheadline: Online shop for curated premium wines
initialItems.management:
Ari Gorenstein
Marcos Leal
Olivier Raussin

content.value: Evino is an innovative online wine business, founded in April 2013 by Ari Gorenstein and Marcos Leal in São Paulo, Brazil. Evino enables its Brazilian customers to get to know and to appreciate the culture of wine drinking. In the exclusive online store, customers are offered a broad and weekly changing assortment of premium wines with an excellent value-for-money. Alternating, limited and thematically oriented flash sales offering a variation chosen premium wines.

initialItems.headline: Saatchi Art
initialItems.subheadline: The world's leading online art gallery

content.value: Saatchi Art is the world’s leading online art gallery, connecting people with art and artists they love. Saatchi Art offers an unparalleled selection of paintings, drawings, sculpture and photography in a range of prices, and it provides artists from around the world with an expertly curated environment in which to exhibit and sell their work. Saatchi Art is redefining the experience of buying and selling art by making it easy, convenient and welcoming for both collectors and artists.

initialItems.headline: Eyeota
initialItems.subheadline: Leading source for 3rd party audience data for advertisers
initialItems.management:
Kevin Tan
Kristina Prokop
Trent Lloyd
Jill Orr (COO)
initialItems.location:
Singapore (Singapore)
Berlin (Germany)
London (UK)
Melbourne (Australia)
New York (USA)
Sydney (Australia)
Tokyo (Japan)

content.value: Eyeota is the global leader for audience data with over 3.5 billion unique profiles. Eyeota provides marketers with the data they need to reach the right online audiences and cut campaign waste whilst also enabling publishers to monetise their audiences more widely. In addition, our data delivers deep audience insight to both marketers and online publishers to help them understand their customers in a new way – as human beings. Eyeota supplies third party audience data to all major global and regional ad buying platforms, trading desks, DSPs, DMPs and ad networks. The company was founded in 2010 and has offices in Berlin, London, Melbourne, New York, Singapore, Sydney, and Tokyo.

initialItems.headline: Tictail
initialItems.subheadline: Free DIY e-commerce platform
initialItems.management:
Carl Rivera
Kaj Drobin
Birk Nilson
Siavash Ghorbani

content.value: Tictail is a free-to-use e-commerce platform which launched in May 2012. The startup was created by Swedish entrepreneur Carl Waldekranz and co-founders Kaj Drobin, Birk Nilson, and Siavash Ghorbani in Stockholm in May 2011. Tictail provides retailers – whether established businesses or new entrepreneurs – with all of the tools necessary to create an online store, ready to accept orders within a matter of minutes, and all for free. With no need for coding or web-design experience, Tictail lets users create a beautiful online shop through its intuitive and accessible interface, offering an extensive range of templates, layouts, and themes. Tictail’s goal is to become the most used and loved e-commerce platform globally. While the basic Tictail service is free, optional apps - for example custom domains, discount codes, analytics, and the ability to sell downloadable digital content – can be purchased, adding extra functionality as and when a business needs it. The focus is on a strong community integration, user friendly and beautiful, adaptable design, which was highlighted by Wired Magazine when they named Tictail as one Europe’s hottest startups in 2012.

initialItems.headline: Uberall
initialItems.subheadline: Global leader in location marketing technology

content.value: Uberall is a global leader in location marketing technology. Its flagship Location Marketing Cloud platform empowers the world’s biggest brands to connect with their customers and turn online interactions into offline sales. Uberall gives businesses central control of their digital presence and online reputation, enabling them to easily manage brand interactions in real-time on all digital platforms—mobile, voice and desktop—across websites, mobile apps, store locators, search engines, maps, social platforms, and advertising networks. The Location Marketing Cloud provides a consistent, accurate digital brand footprint that helps businesses capture new customers and maximize revenue for every location. Uberall is headquartered in Berlin, with additional offices in San Francisco, London, Paris, Amsterdam, and Cape Town. Its clients include Fortune 500 companies and industry leaders from all over the world.

initialItems.headline: Adglow
initialItems.subheadline: Optimizing advertiser's social media campaigns

content.value: Adglow has been investing heavily to build its own social media demand-side platform (DSP), creating niche technology to be able to efficiently buy social media inventory in video, mobile and search engine channels. Their powerful software along with Facebook (Marketing Partner) and Twitter (Marketing Platform Partner) certifications put Adglow in a strategic position to be able to offer both advertisers and agencies the best technology to meet their social media advertising needs: ADAM. ADAM is not just Adglow’s proprietary DSP for social media, allowing advertisers to purchase inventory in social media through real-time bidding (RTB); it also helps Adglow professionals around the world to design, manage, optimize and extract data and key insights from social media ad campaigns.

initialItems.headline: 42matters
initialItems.subheadline: European pioneer in mobile targeting data
initialItems.management:
Andrea Girardello
Ivan Delchev
Andreas Budde
Bo Wang

content.value: 42matters, headquartered in Zurich is a high-tech company and pioneer in mobile app marketing. The company has developed an innovative solution to targeting customers, by creating profiles based on a user’s app-graph. 42matters’ customers include advertising companies and telecommunications organisations, as well as big and small app developers. 42matters collects data, profiles it and then offers this data in several leading DMPs to a broad group of advertisers. 42matters is also developing one of the most comprehensive App Market APIs available worldwide. 42matters AG was founded in 2011 by Andrea Girardello, Ivan Delchev, Andreas Budde and Bo Wang.

initialItems.headline: Metrigo
initialItems.subheadline: Data-driven solutions for display advertising campaigns
initialItems.management:
Tobias Schlottke
Christian Müller
Philip Westermeyer

content.value: Metrigo provides custom-made, innovative and data-driven solutions for direct response driven display advertising campaigns. metrigo’s proprietary Demand Side Platform (DSP) includes Data Management, Real Time Bidding and Ad Serving. It allows its customers to reach quantitative conversion and objectives via display advertising, with a focus on prospecting.
Exited in November 2013 to Zanox

initialItems.headline: Toroleo
initialItems.subheadline: Free price comparison for car parts

content.value: Toroleo is a free product and price comparison website for car parts, car accessories and car services. The platform enables users to compare products across all price and quality levels in a clear and comfortable way. After choosing the favorite retailer, products can be directly ordered in a suitable partner shop. Toroleo provides its customers with an independent and transparent market overview.
Sold to Delticom in August 2014.

initialItems.headline: Semasio
initialItems.subheadline: User intelligent platform for data-driven advertising

content.value: Semasio GmbH develops and markets a SaaS platform that turns every contact an agency or advertiser has with internet users into profile data. Based on these data, the platform generates target groups for specific marketing goals. The profiling and target group generation processes rely solely on statistical modeling and machine learning. Founded in 2010 the company is headquartered in Hamburg with development centers in Denmark and Portugal. Semasio’s customers include large media and performance agencies.

initialItems.headline: Kochzauber
initialItems.subheadline: Delivered cooking boxes with seasonal recipes and fresh ingredients

content.value: Kochzauber is a Berlin-based startup with the mission to enable healthy and tasty cooking every day with an innovative, convenient nutrition concept. With its Kochzauber boxes, the company offers varied, healthy recipes with matching, fresh ingredients. The boxes are delivered all over Germany directly to the customer's home. All recipes are developed by nutrition experts, adapted to the customer needs. Furthermore, Kochzauber is leading in offering individual cooking boxes: for example for vegetarians, families, fitness enthusiasts or seasonal events — individual and for everyone’s taste.

initialItems.headline: nu3
initialItems.subheadline: Nutrition from Berlin

content.value: The Berlin-based startup stands for smart nutrition. nu3 creates products that make a healthy and balanced lifestyle very easy. Whether it’s a healthy diet, reaching personal fitness goals or losing weight, nu3 combines efficacy with great taste from the best ingredients to enable you to succeed. The company was founded in 2011, and is headed-up by the managing directors Dr. Robert Sünderhauf and Kassian Ortner. nu3 has online shops in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and France, and also offers an international shop on
www.nu3.com

initialItems.headline: natue
initialItems.subheadline: Online shop for wellness and health products

content.value: Natue is an e-commerce with a wide portfolio of wellness and health products, such as supplements, sports nutrition, natural cosmetics, nutricosmetics, slimming products and vitamins. The mission is to be the place to be for people who look for a healthy lifestyle. Founded in December 2012 by a doctor, Fabio Katayama, and an economist, Priscila Capellato. Natue hence offers an individualized buying assistance by nutritionists and a very rich level of information about each product.

initialItems.headline: Wine in Black
initialItems.subheadline: Curated premium wines

content.value: Wine in Black is a startup with an innovative online wine concept and belongs to the fastest growing companies in the field of wine e-commerce. In its exclusive online shop, Wine in Black offers a constantly changing assortment of premium wines, curated by experienced wine experts. Every type of wine is presented with additional information regarding quality and origin which enables the customers to find a wine for every individual taste. Wine in Black therefore facilitates easy and fast wine shopping, even for unexperienced wine lovers. The company is based in Berlin and was founded in June 2011 by Christian Hoya and Stephan Linden.

initialItems.headline: Tirendo
initialItems.subheadline: E-Commerce for tires and car parts
initialItems.management:
Dr. Martin Kern
Erik Heinelt
Felix Vögtle

content.value: The Tirendo Holding GmbH is an European online tire dealer and car accessories shop. In order to always offer the best service, Tirendo relies on a dynamic team of experienced industry experts, Internet professionals and tire specialists. The goal is to provide customers a novel and straightforward buying experience with professionalism, passion and innovation as well as excellent value for money. The main focus is on quality, speed and on competent customer service.
Exited in September 2013 to Delticom.

initialItems.headline: Amerano
initialItems.subheadline: Personalized men's fashion

content.value: AMERANO is an online shop for personalized men´s fashion. From suit to shoes, from cashmere jersey to cufflink, each detail can be personalized. Through individual style advice look and correct fit are guaranteed. After the first online order, the customer’s clothing sizes are saved, which makes repeat orders or corrections convenient. The products are manufactured in Europe and directly shipped to the customer.
